alert.note: Alert for Catahoula; Franklin (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 11 at 11:04AM CDT until May 11 at 11:45AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM CDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL CATAHOULA AND SOUTHERN FRANKLIN PARISHES... At 1103 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Enterprise, or 9 miles north of Harrisonburg, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Jigger around 1140 AM CDT. Wisner around 1145 AM CDT. Winnsboro and Gilbert around 1155 AM CDT. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
